instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 3115, Don't turn on
threads.message:
Hey, 

Another one, with fake charge work perfectly but original don't!! no liquid damage.. 

what can be? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 3115, Don't turn on
threads.message: Bad DC in board, or check over your entire 1-wire circuit.

threads.title: 820 3115, Don't turn on
threads.message:
Original charger detects leakage on the board.
Usually one of <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/85.
Measure <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 onboard.
Depending which one shows much lower value, you will know if is one of these MOSFETs...

threads.title: 820 3115, Don't turn on
threads.message:
Ty Paul for your reply!!

2informaticos <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> problem.. already replace and the machine comes to life!

many thanks!!
